reviews.title: good choice
reviews.text: Traveled with daughter to NY for her 12th b-day. Haven't been back in 18 years so I was leary, but the Comfort Inn was truly a comfort. Room was very comfortable and clean, but the walls were a bit thin. Breakfast could only have been better if the bagels were NOT from a package!
hotel is very nice clean and frindly staff.front desk staff very nice
reviews.title: best hotel in brooklyn

reviews.text: very easy to find .Nice decor room.nice breakfast.i enjoyed my stayed
reviews.title: Great choice!

likes.liked: — There are lots of great restaurants within walking distance, or a short cab ride!

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel in October for a business trip. I was leary at first, since I have never been to Brooklyn, but this hotel was very easy to find and in a great neighborhood. I asked for a room facing the Bay when I got there and they were able to grant the request, I had a pretty good view!
reviews.title: Comfortable Comfort Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds were comfortable, the rooms a good size and clean, free wireless internet, very helpful and friendly staff, especially Joey on the night desk. The breakfast was the standard Comfort Inn pastries and coffee, nothing special.
reviews.title: Will Return
Excellant choice
reviews.text: Overall, this is an excellent choice hotel if you are planning a trip to Brooklyn. I would definitely stay again.

I didn't encounter the issues that others had written about that left poor marks. My stay was very good. The hotel in and-out was very clean and well kept. The staff was also very polite and helpful. Even the coffee was always fresh. The rooms are small, however they are manageable. I usually took a taxi whenever I traveled, but if your heading for Manhattan it may be a good walk to the nearest subway. The biggest satisfaction was the cleanliness, it goes a long way in a big city to come back to a clean hotel each day.
reviews.title: Excellent and CLEAN !
Good but watch the parking
reviews.text: We are big fans of the Choice Hotel chain, which includes Comfort, Sleep Inn, Clarion, and Quality Inns. They are unfailingly clean, have free internet, and while basic are always comfortable and a good value (we paid $116 per night here on an AARP discount).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This one in Brooklyn near Coney Island Avenue was no exception. Unfortunately, our stay was marred by a break in to our vehicle which was parked on the side lot parking (not affiliated with the Comfort inn, which only has about 5-7 spaces). Take their advice and park in the motel nearby (not the one behind th einn itself) for a better experience.
reviews.title: Average rating

likes.liked: — No in-room safe, no mini-fridge, noisy air conditioning.

reviews.text: My husband and I spent 3 nights in Comfort Inn in Brooklyn this past weekend. It was OK for a short stay. However, the big disappointment was that the room lacked in-room safe, so I had to carry my valuables with me all the time. Another annoying thing was the air-conditioning. The room does not have central air, so it was very noisy in the room when air conditioner was running.
reviews.title: No frills, but no complaints

reviews.text: Cheap motel behind the Comfort Inn and the bar nearby did not allow opening windows at night as loud music and cars provided background noise.
reviews.title: Tried to stay there

likes.liked: — Location was closest to where I needed to be

reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay at the Comfort Inn, Brooklyn Bridge. I found the staff helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Helpful Staff

reviews.text: The breakfast was good and I was able to forego lunch on most days because of it. The staff was able to answer my questions about getting around and even suggested a few things I should check out when in Manhattan. The subway was a little far, 10minute walk, but as a solo-female traveller I never felt unsafe or scared going to or coming from the station. After the first night I asked for a room higher up (I was on the ground floor) and it was no problem to switch. The rooms were smallish, but it was just me there, so it was ok. Everything was clean and nice.
reviews.title: No complaints whatsoever!
An "Upscale Hookers Joint" when the Windjammer is too busy!
reviews.text: The shining point for this hotel was the staff! I enjoyed getting "local" tips. It made me feel as though they cared about my experience even more!

What do people expect from a moderately priced Comfort Inn? How can anyone say this hotel is a dump? Sure - it ain't the Marriott at Brooklyn Bridge but then again, you ain't paying 600 bucks a night! So what do you get for your money?
reviews.title: Very nice stay
